reviews.text: evening entertainment was god but you had to be there very early to get a seat.
reviews.title: Lots of fun and excellent weather!

likes.disliked: — The hotel food is nice, but if you stay longer than a week it may become repetitive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff at Bamburi are amongst the most helpful and friendly you will find anywhere in the world, nothing is too much trouble for them. I have read some reviews on here saying they have had problems with air con, tv etc etc. All I would say is things break here like anywhere else, but if you go to reception (24 hours) they will fix or replace anything or even move you if necessary.
reviews.title: Excellent service, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have early trips they will have staff there at whatever time you want to serve you breakfast, just ask. Excellent service and truly lovely people. The beach boys can be a bit of a pain and are pretty persistent, but you can also have a laugh with them. Just be firm and polite and you'll have no problems. Many people booked good trips with them, butif you don't want to just tell them you have booked everything already and they will leave you alone.
reviews.title: jambo jambo

likes.liked: — comfortable bed,good air con,nice view, clean and tidy.
likes.disliked: — food can be monotonous, beach boys can be annoying.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Things to do
reviews.title: Not ALL inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think Haller Park (about 10 mins away) is excellent for kids and big kids like me lol! You can feed giraffes, watch hippos and crocodiles being fed and stroke the giant tortoises - excellent fun and a cheap day / afternoon out (animals are fed from 3-5).
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Safaris are best booked with local operators. You get more for you money and an itinerary that suits you. No fixed departure dates or itineraries, what you want, when you want. I used Julius Safaris who is excellent. Message me if you would like his details, you'll find a lot of excellent reviews on here about him. He also keeps the number of people in a van to a minimum which I think is very important.
reviews.title: Stunning safari and Relaxing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hi we stayed in this hotel in oct 2007 on first impressions i thought o my god where have we come But and a big but first impressions were WRONG. We got a room with balcony overlooking the ocean (room number 201)it was great ok the sea was noisy at night but after two nights we got use to it.The room itself was clean air conditioning did not work but one visit to reception and it got fixed the bed had a moskito net and it does work i think i only got two bites all the time i was there. the pool was ok there was always beds to have the beach was full of seaweed and sellers i must admit they do get annoying but ignore them you can do it they do leave you alone after a few days but if u like wood carvings this is the place to get them and haggle dont pay what they wantsettle for about a third of what they ask for and you will be right but whatever you do dont be scared of them they will leave you alone in the end. Now the food this is where it gets trickysome days its great others we lived on chip buttys there is a nice indian just up the street form the hotel its cheap well i think so. The hotel staff is always cheerfull and they will do anything for you remember these people work for 2.50 a day so a couple of quid tips will keep them happy and you very happy in all i will go back to this hotel it was a nice plce for everything but the food some days. by the way i gave it a low score for the food the seewead and the beachboys
reviews.title: loved most of the holiday

likes.liked: — the room and the moskito net

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I Just got back from Bamburi Beach ... 17-Dec-08 Overall the experience was quite good:
reviews.title: Good'n Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: but first I'll list my views on the negative aspect: I suppose a few are not entirely the Hotels fault. the running cold water is almost non-existent, very difficult to have a shower (I think this applies to most Mombasa hotels) the Menu's are varied but the cooking is very hit and miss (the meat tends to be very tough) but an ideal place for Veggies! ... the hotel itself is VERY Disabled/Handicapped unfriendly!! (lots of stairs ... very up'n down) - there are a few Token wheelchair ramps.
reviews.title: best holiday ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now to the good stuff, the staff are Wonderful ... special mentions to Victor (our tour rep) and Mercy (pronounced Marcie - the Hotels Guest Liasson lady) but: everyone always had time for a friendly smile and a cheery greeting ... Jambo to them ALL!!!
reviews.title: Good Hotel

likes.disliked: — towells and roms after being cleaned can smell quite bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: the daytime/evening entertainment was basic (but I put that down to my personal taste) I'm not a fan of lets all join in and have fun type Hols, it reminds me of Butlins 50yrs ago ... Oh yeah! I forgot to mention I'm 60ish ... there is a mixture of ages ... but I'm guessing that the entertainment/sports are aimed mainly at middle aged people 40 to 60, very little for the Younger and Older guests.
reviews.title: loved it

likes.liked: — room had view of both pools and beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I recomend this hotel? NO Would I ever return to this hotel? NO
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have stayed in a few bad hotels but this is the only one I have been to that I would never go back to, it was like the television programme Benidorm, only worse! The all inclusive functioni s a complete waste of time, I could not get a drink for love nor money! You ask for water and you get one measly glass, you are not allowed to fill up even a small water bottle so I spent two weeks constantly dehydrated! At lunch & dinner waiters "serve" you drinks, every mealtime we would wait at least 15 minutes to order our drink, they then would not return! So you are restricted to one drink per meal, we tried tipping and it didnt help - ended up being even more of a waste of money! The food was ok, I would highly recomend the Karibu snack bar at lunch and for evening (you have to pre book this) rather than the buffet as you are more likely to get served here!
reviews.title: 20th Sept - 4th Oct 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very outdated, only one bulb out of 3 worked in our bathroom, the air con did not work and every evening we had to go all the way to reception to ask for someone to fix it, a guy would arrive with the control and re-set the unit, 10 minutes after he left it broke again - this happened EVERY Evening so we gave up in the end and it felt like a sauna!
reviews.title: october 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You cannot use the beach, no sunbeds are allowed and it is full of seaweed. Sunbeds are situated around the pool but never enough, I waited over 1.5 hours for one! I complained to the manager and he told me "of course we have enough!", clearly they dont!
reviews.title: Short but very sweet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The evening entertainment was very bad.
reviews.title: holiday 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We returned from Kenyan on 6 September this year. This was the third trip to Kenya and this hotel for my son and myself, albeit therre was another member to our party this time. Every time we have done one safari or another and this time repeated the first time we came but added a visit to Treetops. The safaris have taken us all over the place from Samburu to the Masai Mara and Tsavo east and west. This time we saw all the big five. The safaris create a little windon in David Atteneborough's world and we are glad to have seen it. Haller park has improved every time we visit it due to the skills in conservation improving. As for the hotel, well it is the most friendly hotel we have ever stayed in on our travels. The food is good and the staff are truly excellent. Mercy is their secret treasure and never to be forgotten. We have made many friends there and contiue to keep contact withthem especially with our true friend Peter. Hope to make a fourth visit but not for a couple of years. Keep up the good work and improvements!
reviews.title: Loved it all over again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from 2 weeks at Bamburi Beach and I must say it is hard to find too much to complain about. Staff are excellent and very friendly, rooms are clean and bright with a great view of the Indian Ocean, food especially breakfast and the selection of cakes were as good as we've come across, drinks were served in proper glasses, the pools were well maintained and constantly cleaned, sunbeds were plentiful but be up early for the best spots, room was cleaned thoroughly and towels changed daily with fresh water provided for cleaning teeth etc, and overall it was a very relaxing 2 weeks.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the "room for improvement" category I would say the entertainment was a bit boring, lots of tribal dance nights and the like, animation team (about 8 of them) seemed to have it easy with a few dances and pool activities all we saw of them, food becomes a bit repetitive but if you're not afraid to try something new that won't be a problem but don't drink the tap water.
reviews.title: Another fantastic holiday in Kenya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The infamous beach traders are a nuisance and will try to sell you anything from ganja to safaris and everything in between and will literally try to have the shirt off your back (and the rest of your clothes as well) when it's close to your last day. A couple of notable exceptions were 2 old fishermen who took us round for an hour when the tide was out to see all the beach life and a disabled lad who makes the tremendous sand sculptures and does not hassle you for money. Leave through the front entrance and you still get the hassle and apart from the brilliant Haller Park where you get to hand feed the Giraffes there is very little there within walking distance apart from other hotels & Barclays Bank.
reviews.title: Our honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our main purpose for choosing this hotel was as a base to go on safari which we arranged and paid for once in Kenya with JT safaris (I've reviewed this separately in order to do it justice - fantastic) but if you are not planning a safari I would say that Sharm El Sheikh is a better option for late season sunshine - about half the price for a similar hotel and 4 hours less flying time.
reviews.title: Had a brilliant time here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for 1 week in October 2011, there had been a lot on bad reviews on the food so we were a bit nervous, i couldn't believe the choice in food that was available, there was different meat cooked on the BBQ grill every-night, they cooked you your own choice of pasta, fried eggs for breaky, cheese and ham toasties, although lots of curry dishes, but plenty of choice.
reviews.title: lovely hotel, great food, brilliant time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Eric the cosmos rep is brilliant, always there to help and had some great trips through him.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday we really enjoyed our stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we did a one night tsavo west trip, ashnil lodge is amazing, so nice, would go back and do a longer safari, seen everything other than a rhino. Defo go again, hotel is gorge, bit of a pain sunbed hopping due to the mass amount of palm trees but over in the far corner by the access to the beach you get sun all day. Only 1 bad thing is the room towels smell like damp so defo take your own shower towels.
reviews.title: If this was the last hotel on earth.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: entertainment do there best but is a bit repeated and after 11.00 it all finishes, good volley ball matches in the pool !
reviews.title: Very Good Holiday for the Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We came on holiday to bamburi beach in September 2011 we had booked it through cosmos and went on safari straight from the airport we stayed in 3 lodges all of which were amazing and we saw lions which was defiantly a highlight!
reviews.title: Not such a good hotel but good safari

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel always sticks in my mind for it's easy going, laid back feel with all the characteristics one needs...nice pool, great white sands beach, and entertainment if you want it.
reviews.title: Welcoming staff and great amenities!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were great. We had my young nephew with us who would run off from time to time and after 1 day of being on property, the staff all called him by his name and were super friendly.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business

reviews.title: Do not use the bathroom!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family

reviews.text: After reading some demeaning reviews about the hotel our party waited with some trepidation about what to expect.
reviews.title: Mercy Mercy

likes.liked: — Power Cuts and not enough hanging space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We obviously went at the right time.From arrival to departure (2 weeks) we were treated very well indeed.All of the staff were courteous, helpful and polite.The restaurant staff, especially Mercy,Silas and Joshua were delightful and made us feel special every time we went to eat.The food was of a high standard and there was a good choice daily.
reviews.title: Better than a 3 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach boys were a bit in your face to begin with but if you were firm and polite to them they would get the message though it did not stop them walking along the beach with you.(They are only trying to make a living).
reviews.title: Better than we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the hotel offers Safaris through its own agents we used a local company which was good value for the money.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled solo
reviews.text: we have stayed in many all inclusive hotels and this one definately is better than 3*. I thought it was fantastic value for money. The rooms are spacious and clean. The food always looked fresh (alot cooked in front of you) with plenty of choice. The beachboys can be a pain which puts you off wanting to walk along the beach, but this is a problem along most of the Kenyan coastal resorts. The staff were fantastic. I did not feel like they were being friendly just to get a tip they were incredibly polite and attentive. We only tip at the end of the holiday as we believe service should be good without tipping each time. Our problem was deciding who to tip as the service by each member of staff was fantastic.
reviews.title: Cracked all my expectations like a woodpeckers bill

description: This warm and friendly hotel welcomes guests with a distinctly African vibe and a fantastic view of the Indian Ocean! The spacious and comfortable rooms offer four poster beds with yards of netting, making nights tropically romantic and worry free. There is a TV, DVD player, Coffee and Tea making facilities in each room. The safe (chargeable) and mini fridge ensure you can relax and enjoy, in air conditioned comfort with quiet, split unit air conditioners or on the terrace with a spectacular view and a cool ocean breeze. The pool edges onto the ocean and the view is terrific! Whether you come to the Bamburi Beach Hotel to relax or to use it as a starting point for your game drives, we do everything we can to ensure your comfort.
